results.title: From kaiser to fuehrer
results.creator_credit: Burton Benjamin and United States Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Twentieth century”.
This film relates the history of the ill-fated Weimar Republic, from after the first World War to 1933. Attributes the causes of the fall of the Republic to the depression, inexperience with democracy and the doubts of many of its adherents.

results.title: Ataturk: father of modern Turkey
results.creator_credit: Burton Benjamin and Columbia Broadcasting System
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Twentieth century”.
Explains how, at the end of World War I, Mustapha Kemal Ataturk took over government and began to Westernise the country. Discusses the various projects he started.

results.title: The First year
results.creator_credit: Barbara A. Chobocky and Documentary Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Tresillian child development series”.
Looks at the important role that fathers can play in the development of their growing child. Centres around three young couples from varied social backgrounds, each with their first child. Suitable for Upper Secondary School students.

results.title: A Gentle birth
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Tresillian child development series”.
This film shows the Le Boyer method of delivery - the childbirth experience of one woman where technological intervention is kept to a minimum, and drugs are replaced by a relaxed supportive environment, with the father present to reassure and comfort the mother. Narrated by Dr. Harry Tischler.

results.title: Baby in arms
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Tresillian child development series”.
Shows the first three months of a baby’s life as the infant interacts with its mother and other members of the family. Emphasizes the baby’s need for love and stimulation, and illustrates the ways in which a baby perceives, responds and communicates its needs to those around it. Suitable for mid-upper Secondary students.

results.title: Chinese Territory
results.creator_credit: Ron Low, Moira Ferguson, Barbara Mariotti and New England Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “The Top end”.
In the late nineteenth century there were six times as many Chinese as Europeans in the Northern Territory and even now Australians of Chinese descent make up a large portion of the population. These third generation Australians are now making efforts to teach Chinese culture and language before it is lost completely. Integration of the Chinese in the Territory has been relatively painless and several Chinese Australians, including Darwin’s first Chinese Lord Mayor, talk about this and their mixed national identity.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ron Low, Moira Ferguson, Barbara Mariotti and New England Film Productions

results.title: George
results.creator_credit: Ron Iddon, Barbara Mariotti, Moira Ferguson, SBS-TV and New England Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Top end”.
Czech born George Chaloupka became fascinated by Aboriginal Art soon after his arrival in Australia in the 1950s. Since 1958 he has lived and worked in the far north of the continent cataloguing and researching Aboriginal Rock Art, some of which goes back twenty thousand years. A trained anthropologist, Chaloupka sees the art of indigenous Australians as an important historic record for both indigenous and white Australians as well as being examples of great aesthetic beauty.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ron Iddon, Barbara Mariotti, Moira Ferguson, SBS-TV and New England Film Productions

results.title: Captain and kings
results.creator_credit: Ron Lowe and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “The Top end”.
The film examines why Greek immigrants settled in Darwin and their contribution to its development both socially and economically. Interviews with Greek small-businessmen and their wives are conducted about their businesses, family life and how they see themselves in both the Greek and Australian communities. Interviews with non-Greek Darwin residents are also conducted.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ron Lowe and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service
